entry.title: Calabi--Yau threefolds in $\mathbb{P}^6$
entry.summary: We study the geometry of $3$-codimensional smooth subvarieties of the complex projective space. In particular, we classify all quasi-Buchsbaum Calabi--Yau threefolds in projective $6$-space. Moreover, we prove that this classification includes all Calabi--Yau threefolds contained in a possibly singular 5-dimensional quadric as well as all Calabi--Yau threefolds of degree at most $14$ in $\mathbb{P}^6$.
entry.arxiv:comment: In Section 3 we added a new result on the classification of quasi-Buchsbaum Calabi--Yau threefolds in $\mathbb{P}^6$. This generalizes the results of the previous Section 3. The abstract and the introduction are adapted. We moreover improved the presentation, corrected the notation, added precise references and added some assumptions (f.e. nondegeneracy of the studied Calabi-Yau threefolds)
